Mamadou Sakho is looking for a way out of Anfield to revive his career in football. 
And his performance in the above video won't damage his chances of attracting potential suitors this January, that's for sure. 
The French defender has been playing with Liverpool's Under-23s side this season, and has apparently been teaching them a thing or two. 
The clip shows the centre-back throwing his defensive responsibilities to one side and showcasing some attacking football. 
And he is actually really good going forward, even if he is up against youngsters of the game. Mamadou Sakho showcases his talent (Photo: Mamadou Sakho / Twitter) The Frenchman schools the Under-23s side (Photo: Mamadou Sakho / Twitter) 
In the video, he beats players with ease, holding them off with his strength while dancing around them like cones - yes, Sakho has twinkle toes it seems. 
On more than one occasion he even hits the back of the net in style and appears to be enjoying himself dominating play. 
Trust us when we say you'll be rubbing your eyes in disbelief that this is a video of SAKHO. Sakho has skills you never knew he had (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty) Sakho is no longer in Jurgen Klopp's plans (Photo: Reuters) 
The 26-year-old, who is no longer in Jurgen Klopp's plans, has attracted interest from a number of clubs including Southampton, West Ham, Sevilla and Galatasaray. 
The Frenchman would prefer to join another Premier League side however, and is understood to favour a move to Southampton. poll loading Will Mamadou Sakho join Southampton? 500+ VOTES SO FAR
